alert.note: Alert for Dickens; Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 09 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kent and southwestern Dickens Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles west of Spur, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spur. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
